column1: Here is the final result in CSV format, separated by semicolons:
What do you call a guy with no arms or legs floating in the water? a: bob
column3: The word bob refers to floating (to move up and down) and a name for a person (usually male).
column4: The object began to bob up and down in the water as it was tossed by the waves.
column5: My friend Bob has always been good at telling jokes.

column1: How many tickles does it take to make an octopus laugh? 10-tickles.
column3: The word tickle refers to the act of lightly touching to cause laughter and also relates to a measure of something (like 10 tickles).
column4: The childs laughter echoed through the room as her father gave her a tickle on her sides.
column5: The doctor recommended using a tickle stick to measure the depth of the water.

column1: Whats the hardest part of a vegetable? the wheelchair.
column3: The word wheelchair refers to a chair with wheels, often used by people with mobility issues, but can also be interpreted humorously as the hardest part of a vegetable (play on words).
column4: The elderly man requires a wheelchair to move around the garden.
column5: The gardener noted that the zucchini grew too large to fit in the wheelchair basket.
